alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Eastern Glacier; Eastern Pondera; Hill; Liberty; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Toole (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 17 at 5:21AM MST until December 17 at 7:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, up to an inch of additional snow will be possible. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...A portion of north-central Montana. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 AM MST this morning. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact this morning`s commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing and drifting snow will also reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Eastern Glacier; Eastern Pondera; Hill; Liberty; Northern Rocky Mountain Front; Toole
